intro: Blepharocalyx salicifolius var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed white-flowered hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red on the underside. The plant produces showy, white to pale pink flowers with a prominent central stigma, typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
